snippet: Asher & Partners in Los Angeles has effectively resigned its California antismoking assignment after seven years, the agency said, by deciding against participating in a mandated review for the account that began last month. The assignment, typica...
lead_paragraph: Asher & Partners in Los Angeles has effectively resigned its California antismoking assignment after seven years, the agency said, by deciding against participating in a mandated review for the account that began last month. The assignment, typically for a five-year term, has an annual budget estimated at $25 million. Barry Schoenfeld, partner and business development director at Asher, attributed the decision to philosophical differences with the Tobacco Control Section of the California Department of Health Services, which administers the anti smoking account. The humorous, award-winning campaign the agency has created is known for ads that show smoking cowboys complaining about health problems.
abstract: Asher & Partners resigns its California antismoking advertising assignment after seven years by deciding against participating in mandated review of account that began last month (Advertising column) (S)
